content: is just a personal preference you are welcome to start with ch3 for a double_crochet and ch2 for a half_double_crochet or even start with a standing stitch do what is comfortable for you stitch counts for the corner are given separately to stitches per side chain spaces will be given separately to the stitches per side blue parentheses are used in some of the trickier rounds giving further instructions and hints to help get your stitch placement right black parentheses indicate a repeat a specified set of stitches to be repeated the indicated amount of times square brackets indicate a repeat that may contain smaller repeats within you will need to repeat this full set of instructions the specified amount of times curly brackets indicate a complete corner * * indicates a complete repeat for a side please note that sometimes tutorials and patterns are photographed at different times which may result in you seeing different hook sizes in the photo please always stick to what the written pattern says if you are using a kit or matching my gauge the pattern is written for colourway 1 if you are following colourway 2 there will be certain rounds where the end instructions such as fasten_off and secure or do not end off might not apply keep a close eye on the colour changes listed on pages 3 and 4 to continue working in the same colour you only need to slip_stitch into the starting stitch or space and begin as the pattern instructs in certain rounds of the pattern you will need to cut your yarn fasten_off and join in the indicated stitch as the pattern instructs please note if you are using delilah in conjunction with any of my other squares to make a blanket you may need to hook down for the last few rounds of the square to obtain the correct final size to match with the sizes of the other squares i have available several rounds mention the hidden stitch first what is this hidden stitch when you have completed your corner it often hides that first stitch after the corner on the previous round so always move the corner slightly to work that first stitch this stitch is counted as the first stitch unless you are asked to skip the hidden st only skip the hidden stitch where i ve indicated to do so sometimes a stitch may also be hidden further into a round we have tried to mention it where possible 5 tu t ori als back loops only blo when working through the back loops i e blo turn your work over and you will see a third loop under the stitch you are working on make sure you work through this loop as well to prevent your stitches from pulling open this technique does not apply when working into single_crochet 6 tu t ori als cluster stitches two d ouble crochet cluster stitch 2dc-cluster yo insert the hook into the
